question: A cargo ship had recently collided into the coast of Istanbul, leading to the temporary closure of the Bosporus strait, one of the Turkish straits. Which other strait forms a part of the Turkish Straits?
explanation: Bosporus also known as strait of Istanbul is an internationally significant waterway located in the northwestern part of Turkey, forming a part of international boundary between Europe and Asia. It along with Dardanelles forms the Turkish straits that connect Aegean and Mediterranean seas to the Black sea.
